item.title: Nose Cargo Door Power Latch System

numlitem.para: Associated latches are extended manually by an accepted maintenance procedure, and
Latches are visually confirmed fully extended.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may remain displayed:

placard.para: Placard on Nose Cargo Door Control Panel: "LATCH(ES) #__ INOP – OPERATE MANUALLY." Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

para.emphasis: CHECK THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF DOOR PATH. SERIOUS INJURY TO PERSONNEL OR EQUIPMENT COULD OCCUR.

note.para: When opening door, if the inoperative Power Latch System prevents the Cam from pushing the door open, continue to cycle the door open manually or electrically (AMM 52-31-00). If door does not operate electrically, jumpers can be used on the following terminals located on the back side of the main control panel:

numlitem.para: Cycle door electrically until all operative latches are in the closed position.
If MOTOR BRAKE has failed in the released position, manual input will not operate latch. Remove electrical connector to restore manual operation.
After the latch is manually positioned, replace electrical connector.
Lock nose cargo door using normal procedures.

Prior to each departure, visually verify all 16 latches are fully extended by viewing that each latch pin is extended to a position within +/- 0.1 inch of the visible end of the bushing (see illustration).
